article.headline: IUPUI 58, Elon University 57
article.story: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) -- Brandon Cole scored 18 points, including a game-tying 3-pointer during a 9-6 run, as IUPUI edged Elon 58-57 Saturday night. Brandon Cameron scored 16 for the Jaguars (4-5), who outlasted Elon through five ties in the second half, including one in the final minute. Elon (2-7) trailed 29-23 at the break but took a 38-36 lead on a James Brett 3-pointer about six minutes into the second half. The Phoenix outscored IUPUI 34-29 in the second half. Chris Chalko led Elon with 15. Colin Wyatt had 10. Following Brett's 3-pointer, the Jaguars went on a 9-6 run and caught up when Cole nailed a 3-pointer with 8:35 left to make it 44-44. After that, it was back-and-forth as the Phoenix tied it up at 50 and took a one-point lead on a pair of free throws by Wyatt. But Angelo Smith hit a layup with 3:03 left to give IUPUI a 52-51 lead. The Phoenix tied three more times in the final three minutes -- the last time at 57-57 with less than one minute remaining -- but never led again. A free throw by Smith gave the Jaguars the winning edge. IUPUI scored 23 points off turnovers, compared with 12 for Elon.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
